data.title: Beautiful Beyonce Knowles
data.meta_description: A guide to the beautiful Mrs. Beyonce Knowles, inludes pictures, filmography, wallpapers, news, and more.
data.text:
Biography

Beyonc√© Giselle Knowles was born September 4, 1981, in Houston, Texas. She is the eldest child of Mathew Knowles and Tina Beyince. Beyonce's first name is a variation of her mother's surname. Beyonce quickly took a shine to dance and singing, by the age of seven she was already singing solo's in her church choir as well as attending dance school. She was a young prodige, as she went on to win many local singing and dancing competitions. Later, when Knowles was a teenager, she attended the High School for the Performing and Visual Arts in Houston Texas, and later attended to Aleif Elsik High School in Houston.

Along with Beyonce's best friend, LavTavia Roberson, a "song and dance" quartet was formed that included LeToya Luckett and Kelly Rowland. The group was named "Girl's Tyme" and performed in a Star Search competition but lost. Beyonce's father (Kelly Rowland's legal guardian) believed in the girl's talent so much that he quite a six figure salary job with the Xerox company, in order to manage the group. The risk payed off as the group was signed to Columbia records in 1996.

Destiny's Child first hit rose in 1998 with a Billboard top ten hit, "No, No, No Part 2". Destiny's Child toured with TLC before their self-titled debut album "Destiny's Child" was released. The group experience turmoil and two of the original members left and another member was added making the quartet a trio, wich involved original members, Kelly Rowland and Beyonce Knowles, as well as new comer Michelle Williams. In 2001 the group won two Grammy Awards for Best R&B Performance by a Duo or Group with Vocals and Best R&B Song. Beyonce was a member of the songwriters who were accredited with the awards. Destiny's Child next album "Survivor" landed the group number one in American, Canadian and UK album charts. In 2001 Beyonce was the first Black female songwriter to win Songwriter of the Year award from the American Society of Composers, Authors, and Publishers Pop Music Awards. The group then split so the member's could persue solo careers, but did reunite for what is describe by the group as their last album entitled "Destiny Fulfilled".

2003 brough Beyonce's first solo album debut, "Dangerously in Love". The album was a huge success and hit #1 in markets such as Canada, the UK, and the US. One of the many singles, "Crazy in Love" had a guest appearance from a rapper named Jay-Z. Beyonce and Jay-Z have been dating since. Beyonce added to her Grammy awards in 2004, with a record-tying five Grammy awards, and in 2006 Beyonce once again added another Grammy award for a duet with Stevie Wonder.

Beyonce has also branched off from her singing career into acting. She got her first real acting gig on an MTV made for TV movie "Carmen: A Hip Hopera". In 2002 she co-starred with Mike Myers in the huge summer blockbuster "Austin Powers in Goldmember". She went on to star in the 2003 film "The Fighting Temptations" opposite to Cuba Gooding Jr. Beyonce continued her acting success with the 2006 film "The Pink Panther" which was released on Feburary 10th and was #1 at the box office opening weekend. Knowles' latest project is Dreamgirls wich is going to be released on December 22, 2006.
